results.adx_keywords: Social Media;Layoffs and Job Reductions;Mobile Applications;Labor and Jobs;Computers and the Internet;Advertising and Marketing;Zuckerberg, Mark E;Meta Platforms Inc;Facebook Inc;Instagram Inc;WhatsApp Inc
results.title: Meta to Lay Off Another 10,000 Workers
results.abstract: It would be the tech company’s second round of cuts since November. Mark Zuckerberg, its chief executive, has declared 2023 the “year of efficiency.”

media.caption: Mark Zuckerberg, Meta’s chief executive, said last month that he did not want his company to be overstuffed with a layer of middle management.
media.copyright: Jason Henry for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Colleges and Universities;Admissions Standards;Women and Girls;Transgender;Women's Rights;Johnson, Paula A (1959- );Wellesley College;Massachusetts
results.title: At Wellesley College, Students Vote to Admit Trans Men
results.abstract: Students supported a nonbinding referendum on Tuesday that calls for opening admission to all nonbinary and transgender applicants. Opponents say the school’s mission is to educate women.

media.caption: Outside of The Lulu Chow Wang Campus Center at Wellesley College, on Monday.
media.copyright: Bea Oyster for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Banking and Financial Institutions;Content Type: Service;Personal Finances;Stocks and Bonds;Deposit Insurance;Federal Deposit Insurance Corp;Securities Investor Protection Corp;Charles Schwab Corporation
results.byline: By Ron Lieber and Tara Siegel Bernard
results.title: Is My Money Safe? Here’s What Is Covered, and How You Can Do More.
results.abstract: The F.D.I.C. and other entities will protect most people’s bank and brokerage balances. But it’s as good a time as any for consumers to create other backstops.

media.caption: The line on Monday outside the former Silicon Valley Bank in Santa Clara, Calif., which opened under new auspices.

results.adx_keywords: Museums;Art;Philanthropy;Lucas, George;Hobson, Mellody;Jackson-Dumont, Sandra;Ma Yansong;Lucas Museum of Narrative Art;Los Angeles (Calif)
results.title: The Lucas Museum Finds Your Lack of Faith Disturbing
results.abstract: George Lucas’s billion-dollar museum, which has faced delays, is finally coming into focus in Los Angeles. Officials say it should be fully operational by 2025.

media.caption: When George Lucas finally decided to build his $1 billion museum, the Lucas Museum of Narrative Art, in Los Angeles, its arrival was jeered by some critics.
media.copyright: Adam Amengual for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Seaweed;Oceans and Seas;Beaches;Fish and Other Marine Life;Travel and Vacations;Water;Florida Atlantic University;Atlantic Ocean;Cancun (Mexico);Caribbean Area;Florida;Mexico
results.byline: By Livia Albeck-Ripka and Emily Schmall
results.title: A Giant Blob of Seaweed is Heading to Florida
results.abstract: The mass, known as the great Atlantic Sargassum belt, is drifting toward the Gulf of Mexico. Scientists say seaweed is likely to come ashore by summer to create a rotting, stinking, scourge.

media.caption: A worker removing sargassum with machinery at a resort in Cancun, Mexico, last year.

results.adx_keywords: Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);United States International Relations;United States Politics and Government;Conservatism (US Politics);DeSantis, Ron;Trump, Donald J;Republican Party;Ukraine
results.byline: By Jonathan Swan and Maggie Haberman
results.title: DeSantis, Backing Away From Ukraine, Angers G.O.P. Hawks
results.abstract: The Florida governor, who joined Donald Trump in declaring that defending Ukraine from Russia was not a vital interest, drew swift condemnations from establishment Republicans.

media.caption: Leading congressional Republicans have framed the Russian invasion as a fight to defend the post-World War II international security framework.

results.adx_keywords: Regulation and Deregulation of Industry;Banking and Financial Institutions;Stocks and Bonds;Securities and Exchange Commission;Valley Bank
results.byline: By Matthew Goldstein and Katie Benner
results.title: U.S. Is Said to Open Investigation Into Silicon Valley Bank Collapse
results.abstract: Legal experts said a focus of the investigation could be insider sales by several bank executives in the weeks before the bank’s failure.

media.caption: Some of Silicon Valley Bank’s executives sold stock pursuant to insider selling plans that set the timing of such sales in advance.
media.copyright: T.J. Kirkpatrick for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Snow and Snowstorms;Power Failures and Blackouts;Weather;Disasters and Emergencies;Wind;Airports;Eversource Energy;Mid-Atlantic States (US);Northeastern States (US);New York State;Massachusetts;Albany (NY);New York City;Binghamton (NY);Worcester (Mass);New Jersey;Connecticut
results.byline: By Jesus Jiménez and Michael Levenson
results.title: Late-Winter Storm Brings Heavy Snow and Rain to the Northeast
results.abstract: A major storm dropped more than two feet of snow in portions of northwest Massachusetts and southern Vermont, while some cities only saw flurries or rain. The weather caused power outages and travel disruptions.

results.adx_keywords: Conservatism (US Politics);Men and Boys;Buckley, William F Jr;Hefner, Hugh;Portnoy, Dave (1977- )
results.title: The Debate Hugh Hefner Won and William Buckley Lost
results.abstract: There’s an unbridgeable divide between Barstool conservatives and social conservatives — and it’s warping the conservative movement.

media.caption: Donald Trump and Melania with Playboy Playmates at a Hugo Boss and Playboy Playmates party in 2001.

results.adx_keywords: Books and Literature;Book Clubs;Book Trade and Publishing;Writing and Writers;Content Type: Personal Profile;audio-neutral-informative;Napolitano, Ann (Author);Winfrey, Oprah
results.title: ‘Hi, This Is Oprah Winfrey. I Read Your Novel and Loved It So Much.’
results.abstract: Ann Napolitano toiled in obscurity for years. Novels went unpublished; agents turned her down. She found recognition with “Dear Edward.” Then came the call: “Hello Beautiful” was the 100th pick for what is arguably the most influential book club in the world.

media.caption: The title of Ann Napolitano’s fourth novel “Hello Beautiful” was inspired by her uncle’s salutation on postcards he sent throughout her childhood. “I felt like he was seeing that I was beautiful on the inside and that’s why he wrote it to me that way,” said Napolitano. “I’ve always felt like my real self is on the inside.”
media.copyright: Elinor Carucci for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Telecommuting;Exercise;Coronavirus Return to Office;Productivity;Workplace Environment;Weight;Depression (Mental)
results.title: Working From Home Is Less Healthy Than You Think
results.abstract: Those who have the luxury of working from home might end up realizing that remote work is disadvantageous to their mental and physical well-being.

media.copyright: Illustration by The New York Times, Photographs by Getty Images

results.adx_keywords: Documentary Films and Programs;Shipwrecks (Historic);Fashion and Apparel;North Sea;Netherlands
results.title: This Dress Survived for More Than Three Centuries at the Bottom of the Sea
results.abstract: Divers found an almost perfectly preserved dress in the remains of a ship that sank off the Netherlands in the 1600s. Researchers are trying to figure out who owned the garment.

media.caption: An almost perfectly preserved dress was recovered from a ship that sank off the Netherlands in the 17th century.

results.adx_keywords: Artificial Intelligence;Computers and the Internet;ChatGPT;OpenAI Labs
results.byline: By Cade Metz and Keith Collins
results.title: 10 Ways GPT-4 Is Impressive but Still Flawed
results.abstract: OpenAI has upgraded the technology that powers its online chatbot in notable ways. It’s more accurate, but it still makes things up.

results.title: Ron DeSantis Says Protecting Ukraine Is Not a Key U.S. Interest
results.abstract: The Florida governor, on Tucker Carlson’s Fox News show, broke with Republicans to attack President Biden’s foreign policy and align more closely with Donald Trump as he weighs a presidential bid.

media.caption: Gov. Ron DeSantis in Iowa last week.

results.title: OpenAI Plans to Up the Ante in Tech’s A.I. Race
results.abstract: The company unveiled new technology called GPT-4 four months after its ChatGPT stunned Silicon Valley. The update is an improvement, but it carries some of the same baggage.

results.adx_keywords: Recipes;Soups;Vegetarianism
results.title: When Winter Meets Spring, It’s Time for These Vegetarian Soups
results.abstract: Parmesan cabbage, coconut curry sweet potato and a golden beet borscht: These three are heavy enough for a chilly day but light enough for spring.

media.caption: This Parmesan cabbage soup, golden beet borscht and coconut curry sweet potato soup let winter vegetables shine.
media.copyright: David Malosh for The New York Times. Food Stylist: Simon Andrews.

results.adx_keywords: internal-sub-only;Pregnancy and Childbirth;Genetics and Heredity;Research;Morning Sickness;Women and Girls;Miscarriages;Nausea;audio-neutral-informative;Fejzo, Marlena
results.title: Her Doctor Said Her Illness Was All in Her Head. This Scientist Was Determined to Find the Truth.
results.abstract: After enduring severe nausea and vomiting in pregnancy, the geneticist Marlena Fejzo made finding the cause of her condition, hyperemesis gravidarum, her life’s work.

media.caption: Hyperemesis gravidarum, a pregnancy condition marked by nausea and vomiting so severe it can cause catastrophic complications for mother and fetus, has long been under researched and under recognized.
media.copyright: Maggie Shannon for The New York Times
